resources.string: We need you to allow this app to Display over other apps (necessary to start Android Auto from a background service).\n\nAfter tapping OK you will land in "Display over other apps" settings screen, please look for Wi-Fi Launcher and allow it.
One more thing, Location Services needs to be set to "Allowed all the time" in order to connect Wireless Android Auto
Please turn Wi-Fi on to start Wireless Android Auto
Please turn Location on to start Wireless Android Auto

Wi-Fi Control (special app access) is necessary for this app.\n\nAfter tapping OK Settings screen will be open and please go to Apps & notifications > Special app access (bottom of the list) > Wi-Fi Control > Wi-Fi Launcher and allow it.

Wi-Fi Control (special app access) is necessary for this app.\n\nAfter tapping OK Settings screen will be open and please go to Apps > 3 dots (upper right) > Special access > Wi-Fi Control > Wi-Fi Launcher and allow it.

You are running MIUI phone and it has a bug while trying to add Wi-Fi Suggestions (UI crash loop), it will crash the system UI because of that bug, so you need to manually grant Special App Access to Wi-Fi Launcher before you proceed.\n\nAfter tapping OK it will open Settings screen and please go to Manage apps > Permissions > Other permissions > Grant every single permission that appears for Wi-Fi Launcher.
Turn Wi-Fi on to start Wireless Android Auto
Turn Location on to start Wireless Android Auto
Notifications when service is running with no sound/vibration
Turn on Wi-Fi or Location Notifications
Notifications when Wi-Fi or Location are off with sound/vibration
This will turn the service off that connects Wireless Android Auto if it loses bluetooth connection. Recommended for users when car display is not turning hotspot off after turning the car off.
Select on which Bluetooth devices to start this app
Bluetooth was off, re open it again
Adds a button in service notification to force connection to car display (needs service restart)
This will start Wi-Fi service to connect Wireless Android Auto.
Don\'t check it if you are using car display hotspot

Note: Use a static/reserved IP in car display to avoid assigning a different IP address every time it connects to the Router (disable DHCP in car display or reserve the IP in the router). If you don\'t do this, it won\'t connect correctly.
Note: Consider Headunit Reloaded app might reset hotspot settings to default (HUR/AndroidAutoConnect) every time it starts. Password must be WPA2 Personal.
Service is connected to car display
Service is looking for car display
Headunit Reloaded Wi-Fi Service is running trying to connect Wireless Android Auto
Oh no! There are permissions denied, tap here to fix it
